poem:
### Fallout

Their whispers shape the cold of night,
a skyline blistered, black with spite.
Beyond the wire, ghost reactors hum,
millions tethered to a silent drum.
Uranium weeps in fractured veins,
while fear cascades like acid rains.
In shadows deep, beneath the clash,
a flicker waits, ready to ash.
